intro: Triolena pileoides subsp. panamensis, commonly known as the Panama triolena, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting body. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
